meanings.definition: superlative of key: most important or essential
meanings.sent1: The safety of the students is the keyest concern for the school.
meanings.sent2: Having a spare tire is keyest when going on a long road trip.
meanings.sent3: For the treasure hunt, the keyest clue was hidden under the big rock.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the keyest to brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The keyest ingredient in the recipe is fresh herbs.

meanings.definition: superlative of key: providing access or control
meanings.sent1: The security guard has the keyest card to enter the restricted area.
meanings.sent2: The password is keyest to unlocking the encrypted file.
meanings.sent3: The magician's keyest trick was making the rabbit disappear.
meanings.sent4: The golden key was the keyest to opening the mysterious door.
meanings.sent5: The keyest code grants access to the secret vault.

meanings.definition: superlative of key: significant or crucial
meanings.sent1: His keyest role in the play was that of the lead actor.
meanings.sent2: The keyest moment of the game was when the winning goal was scored.
meanings.sent3: The detective's keyest clue led to the capture of the criminal.
meanings.sent4: The keyest decision she made was to pursue her dream career.
meanings.sent5: The keyest event of the year is the annual charity gala.
